sen.j: 鳥羽天皇（とばてんのう、康和5年1月16日（1103年2月24日） - 保元元年7月2日（1156年7月20日））は平安時代後期の第74代天皇（在位1107年 - 1123年）。
sen.e: Emperor TOBA (February 24th, 1103 - July 20th, 1156) was the 74th Emperor in late Heian Period. (His reign was 1107 - 1123.)
Emperor Toba (February 24, 1103 - July 20, 1156) was the seventy-fourth Emperor in the late Heian period (his reign was from 1107 - 1123).
Emperor Toba (February 24, 1103 - July 20, 1156) was the seventy-fourth Emperor in the late Heian period (his reign was from 1107 - 1123).

sen.j: 諱は宗仁（むねひと）。
sen.e: His posthumous name was Munehito.
sen.cmt: 諱→personal name[いみな] 諱 サンプル訳より
sen.e: His posthumous name was Munehito.
His posthumous name was Munehito.

sen.j: 堀河天皇の皇子。
sen.e: He was the Prince of Emperor HORIKAWA.
He was the prince of Emperor Horikawa.
He was the prince of Emperor Horikawa.

sen.j: 母は贈皇太后藤原苡子。
sen.e: His mother was the Empress Dowager, posthumously conferred, FUJIWARA no Ishi.
sen.cmt: 贈皇太后→the Empress Dowager, posthumously conferred [定訳不明]
sen.e: His mother was the Empress Dowager (posthumously conferred), FUJIWARA no Ishi.
His mother was the Empress Dowager (posthumously conferred), FUJIWARA no Ishi.

sen.j: 外祖父は藤原実季。
sen.e: His maternal grandfather was FUJIWARA no Sanesue.
His maternal grandfather was FUJIWARA no Sanesue.
His maternal grandfather was FUJIWARA no Sanesue.

sen.j: 崇徳天皇、近衛天皇、後白河天皇は子。
sen.e: His children were Emperor SUTOKU, Emperor KONOE and Emperor GO-SHIRAKAWA.
His children were Emperor SUTOKU, Emperor KONOE and Emperor GO-SHIRAKAWA.
His children were Emperor Sutoku, Emperor Konoe and Emperor Goshirakawa.

sen.j: 『古事談』の記述では崇徳天皇を白河天皇の実子としている。
sen.e: According to the description in "Kojidan", it was said Emperor SUTOKU is Emperor SHIRAKAWA's child.
According to the description in "Kojidan," it was said that Emperor Sutoku was Emperor Shirakawa's child.
According to the description in "Kojidan," it was said that Emperor Sutoku was Emperor Shirakawa's child.

tit.cmt: "Biography" -> "Brief Personal History" に変更しました。

sen.j: 生後間もなく母苡子が没し、祖父の白河法皇の下に引き取られて養育された。
sen.e: His mother, Ishi died soon after the Emperor was born, he was then taken and raised by his grandfather, the retired Emperor SHIRAKAWA in pious life.
His mother, Ishi, died soon after the Emperor was born, and then he was then taken and raised by his grandfather, the retired Emperor Shirakawa in pious life.
His mother, Ishi, died soon after the Emperor was born, and then he was then taken and raised by his grandfather, the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa.
sen.cmt: retired→Cloistered法皇をCloistered Emperorとすると、そのあとに続くin pious lifeと意味が重なるため、In pious lifeは削除しました。

sen.j: 父堀河天皇の死後、5歳で即位。
sen.e: He succeeded to the throne when he was five, after his father, the retired Emperor HORIKAWA died.
He succeeded to the throne when he was five, after the death of his father, the retired Emperor Horikawa.
He succeeded to the throne when he was five, after the death of his father, the Emperor Horikawa.

sen.j: 政務は白河法皇が執った。
sen.e: The retired Emperor SHIRAKAWA in pious life took actual control of the government.
The retired Emperor Shirakawa in pious life took actual control of the government.
The Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa took actual control of the government.
sen.cmt: retired→Cloistered法皇をCloistered Emperorとすると、そのあとに続くin pious lifeと意味が重なるため、In pious lifeは削除しました。

sen.j: 永久5年（1117年）白河法皇の養女である藤原璋子（待賢門院）が入内、翌年中宮とし五男二女をもうける。
sen.e: In 1117, the retired Emperor SHIRAKAWA's (in pious life) adopted daughter, FUJIWARA no Shoshi (Taiken mon in) made an Imperial Consort's bridal entry into court, she then became the second consort of an emperor, and had five boys and two girls.

In 1117, the retired Emperor Shirakawa's (in pious life) adopted daughter, FUJIWARA no Shoshi (Taiken mon in) made an Imperial consort's bridal entry into court, whereupon she became the second consort of an Emperor, and had five boys and two girls.

In 1117, the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa's adopted daughter, FUJIWARA no Shoshi (Taiken mon in), made her bridal entry as an Imperial Consort into the court, whereupon she became the second consort of the Emperor, and had five boys and two girls.
sen.cmt: retired→Cloistered法皇をCloistered Emperorとすると、そのあとに続くin pious lifeと意味が重なるため、In pious lifeは削除しました。consort's→Consort's文法。 “an Emperor” ではｄの天皇か不明。「入内」の訳確認。 “The” Emperor?

sen.j: 保安4年（1123年）1月23日長子崇徳天皇に譲位、その後も実権は白河法皇が握り続けた。
sen.e: On January 23rd 1123, the eldest child, Emperor SUTOKU succeeded to the throne, however after this the retired Emperor Shirakawa in pious life still took control of the government.
On January 23, 1123, the eldest child, Emperor Sutoku, succeeded to the throne; however, after this the retired Emperor Shirakawa in pious life retained control of the government.
On January 23, 1123, the eldest child, Emperor Sutoku, succeeded to the throne; however, after this the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa retained control of the government.
sen.cmt: retired→Cloistered法皇をCloistered Emperorとすると、そのあとに続くin pious lifeと意味が重なるため、In pious lifeは削除しました。

sen.j: 白河法皇の死後、大治4年（1129年）より院政を敷く。
sen.e: After the retired Emperor Shirakawa in pious life died, Emperor TOBA started ruling his cloister government.
sen.cmt: 院政 →cloister government 英次郎 on the web
sen.e: After the retired Emperor Shirakawa in pious life died, Emperor TOBA started ruling his cloister government.
After the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa died, Emperor Toba started ruling his cloister government in 1129.
sen.cmt: retired→Cloistered法皇をCloistered Emperorとすると、そのあとに続くin pious lifeと意味が重なるため、In pious lifeは削除しました。TOBA→Tobain 1129補足

sen.j: 白河法皇に疎んじられていた藤原忠実を呼び戻して娘の藤原泰子（高陽院）を入内させるなど、院の要職を自己の側近で固める。
sen.e: The Emperor called back FUJIWARA no Tadazane who was disfavored by the retired Emperor SHIRAKAWA in pious life, he then arranged his daughter, FUJIWARA no Taishi (Kaya no in) an Imperial Consort's bridal entry into court, also established all the significant post with his close aides.

The Emperor called back FUJIWARA no Tadazane, who was disfavored by the retired Emperor Shirakawa in pious life, and he then arranged his daughter, FUJIWARA no Taishi (Kaya no in) an Imperial Consort's bridal entry into the court, and filled all the significant posts with his close aides.

The Emperor called back FUJIWARA no Tadazane, who was disfavored by the Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa, and he then arranged his daughter, FUJIWARA no Taishi (Kaya no in) an Imperial Consort's bridal entry into the court, and filled all the significant posts with his close aides.
sen.cmt: retired→Cloistered法皇をCloistered Emperorとすると、そのあとに続くin pious lifeと意味が重なるため、In pious lifeは削除しました。

sen.j: さらに白河法皇の後ろ盾を失った中宮璋子にかわり、藤原得子（美福門院）を寵愛して、所生の皇子体仁親王（近衛天皇）を即位させた。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Emperor loved FUJIWARA no Tokushi (Bifuku mon in), taking over the second consort of the emperor, Shoshi, and appointed his son, Prince Narihito (the Emperor Konoe) to succeed the throne.

Furthermore, the Emperor loved FUJIWARA no Tokushi (Bifuku mon in), taking over as the second consort of the emperor, Shoshi, and appointed his son, Prince Narihito (the Emperor Konoe) to succeed the throne.

Furthermore, the Emperor loved FUJIWARA no Tokushi (Bifuku mon in), taking over as the second consort of the emperor, Shoshi who lost support from the Cloister government Goshirakawa, and appointed his son, Prince Narihito (the Emperor Konoe) to succeed the throne.
sen.cmt: 原文の「白河法皇の後ろ盾を失った」を訳出しました。

sen.j: 崇徳天皇、近衛天皇、後白河天皇の三代28年に渡り実権を掌握。
sen.e: He took control of the politics for twenty eight years, during three generation from Emperor SUTOKU, Emperor KONOE and Emperor GO-SHIRAKAWA.
He held control of the politics for 28 years, during the three generations from Emperor Sutoku, Emperor Konoe and Emperor Go-Shirakawa.
He held control of the politics for 28 years, during the three generations from Emperor Sutoku, Emperor Konoe and Emperor Goshirakawa.

sen.j: 康治元年（1142年）には東大寺戒壇院にて受戒し、法皇となった。
sen.e: In 1142 he became a retired Emperor in pious life after being ordained as a Buddhist priest by receiving the commandments of Buddhism at Todai-ji Temple Kaidan in [the building that houses 'the ordination platform'].
sen.cmt: 東大寺戒壇院→Todai-ji Temple Kaidan in [the building that houses 'the ordination platform']
sen.e: In 1142 he became a retired Emperor in pious life after being ordained as a Buddhist priest by receiving the orders of Buddhism at Todai-ji Temple Kaidan in [the building that houses the 'ordination platform'].
In 1142 he became a Cloistered Emperor after being ordained as a Buddhist priest by receiving the orders of Buddhism at Todai-ji Temple Kaidan in [the building that houses the 'ordination platform'].
sen.cmt: retired→Cloistered法皇をCloistered Emperorとすると、そのあとに続くin pious lifeと意味が重なるため、In pious lifeは削除しました。

sen.j: 皇后美福門院に動かされて崇徳上皇を疎んじ、鳥羽法皇の崩御の直後に保元の乱が勃発する原因を作った。
sen.e: He disfavored the ex-Emperor SUTOKU as he followed Empress Bifuku mon in and indirectly caused the Hogen War just before the retired Emperor TOBA in pious life died.
He disfavored the ex-Emperor Sutoku since he followed Empress Bifuku mon in, and indirectly caused the Hogen War just before the death of the retired Emperor Toba in pious life.
He disfavored the retired Emperor Sutoku since he followed Empress Bifuku mon in, and indirectly caused the Hogen War just after the death of the Cloistered Emperor Toba.
sen.cmt: ex-Emperor→retired Emperorbefore→afterretired→Cloistered法皇をCloistered Emperorとすると、そのあとに続くin pious lifeと意味が重なるため、In pious lifeは削除しました。

sen.e: Kasho (August 9th, 1107) - August 3rd, 1108
Kasho (August 9, 1107) - August 3, 1108
Kasho (August 9, 1107) - August 3, 1108
Ten-nin August 3rd, 1108 - July 13th, 1110
Ten-nin August 3, 1108 - July 13, 1110
Tennin August 3, 1108 - July 13, 1110
Ten-ei July 31st, 1110 - July 13th, 1113
Ten-ei July 31, 1110 - July 13, 1113
Tenei July 31, 1110 - July 13, 1113
Eikyu July 13th, 1113 - April 3rd, 1118
Eikyu July 13, 1113 - April 3, 1118
Eikyu July 13, 1113 - April 3, 1118
Genei April 3rd, 1118 - April 10th, 1120
Genei April 3, 1118 - April 10, 1120
Genei April 3, 1118 - April 10, 1120
Hoan April 10th, 1120 - (January 28th, 1123)
Hoan April 10, 1120 - (January 28, 1123)
Hoan April 10, 1120 - (January 28, 1123)

sen.j: 京都府京都市伏見区竹田内畑町の安樂壽院陵（あんらくじゅいんのみささぎ）に葬られる｡
sen.e: The Emperor was entombed in Anrakujuin no misasagi, Uchihata-cho Town, Takeda, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The Emperor was entombed in Anrakujuin no misasagi, Uchihata-cho Town, Takeda, in the Fushimi ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The Emperor was entombed in Anrakujuin no misasagi, Uchihata-cho Town, Takeda, in the Fushimi Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 『新・平家物語 (映画)』（1955年 監督：溝口健二、演：夏目俊二）
sen.e: "Shin Heike Monogatari (The New Tale of the Heike) (movie)" (1955 directed by Kenji MIZOGUCHI, played by Shunji NATSUME

"Shin Heike Monogatari (The New Tale of the Heike)" (a 1955 movie directed by Kenji MIZOGUCHI, played by Shunji NATSUME)
